column4: nod Saga_ check out bum, boot-up manager might be what you want
or just add the user and link the /home dir later
no, its from my old install... just did a clean install but kept the /home partition
you picked a new username and want to reassociate it with an old home dir?
no, I have about 4 users on this machine... they all have directories in /home and need user accounts so they can log in
but the admin->users and groups gets annoyed because their home directories already exist
thought there was something for that in the installer now nibsa1242 :/ but maybe it doesnt work right
well nibsa1242 you tried to manually create the users on the commandline, without giving them a home dir
you can add that in later in the gui
easiest way i can think of to fix it
I just installed and it didn't ask me anything or set them up properly... I installed from live cd... perhaps alternate had options. I normally do alternate, seems to be more configurable.
yeah ive done a few installs and its only asked to import a fraction of those times
no I'll try that, I've never created a user that way before, so I was afraid to do that.
theres good steps on the forums nibsa1242
